AD_Fail.synopsis: Announces that the player has failed the puzzle, either by placing the wrong painting on the wall or by stealing a painting.
AD_Fail.how_to_trigger: Take any of the paintings on th wall in the Trial of Justice;Put the wrong painting on the wall.

AD_Success.synopsis: The statues comment on the player's success in the painting puzzle.

Painting1.synopsis: Tells part of the story conveyed by the paintings in a puzzle.

PAD_PaintingBlocked.synopsis: Players are trying to interact with a painting while the aura of an evil Judged blocks them from doing so.
PAD_PaintingBlocked.how_to_trigger: In BGO_Main_A, teleport to 'The Cell' - S_WYR_PaintingPuzzle_SolutionPainting3 - 38e88703-d24d-462e-8032-98a2d77465d4 - (-906 28 -1016) and click on it.

Rules.synopsis: Statue at the Justice puzzle tells the rules.

SolutionPainting2_AD_0.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting2_AD_0.text: *'Freedom.' A red-haired man walks the streets of Baldur's Gate, clad in a billowing cloak.*

SolutionPainting2_AD_1.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting2_AD_1.text: *You catch a glimpse of a sly smile beneath his hood and a golden coin in his hand.*

Painting2_1.speaker: Narrator
Painting2_1.text: *'The Child'. A red-haired man is portrayed with his cloak's hood lowered, giving an apple to a smiling urchin.*

Painting2_0.speaker: Narrator
Painting2_0.text: *Several other children are huddled behind the one receiving the apple, hands outstretched.*

SolutionPainting1_AD_3.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting1_AD_3.text: *'The Hanging.' A red-haired man is depicted hanging from a gallows as a crowd looks on.*

SolutionPainting1_AD_5.speaker: Wyll
SolutionPainting1_AD_5.text: A harsh sentence for all but the most heinous crimes.

SolutionPainting1_AD_0.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting1_AD_0.text: *You notice a child in the crowd, a falling tear leaving a trail on his cheek.*

Painting4_2.speaker: Narrator
Painting4_2.text: *'The Theft'. A red-haired man is depicted in the Hall of Wonders, thieving an astrolabe of entrapment.*

Painting4_5.speaker: Narrator
Painting4_5.text: *'The Theft'. A red-haired man is depicted in the Hall of Wonders, thieving what looks to be a priceless artefact.*

Painting4_8.speaker: Narrator
Painting4_8.text: *It's an astrolabe of entrapment. It could hold a dozen djinn within it - perhaps even more.*

PAD_Entrance_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_0.text: Paintings hung on the wall - almost like an art gallery.

Painting3_1.speaker: Narrator
Painting3_1.text: *'The Induction'. A red-haired man is depicted in hushed conversation with a dark-haired woman.*

Painting3_0.speaker: Narrator
Painting3_0.text: *She wears a cloak with an unusual symbol on it: tally marks totalling the number 'nine'.*

AD_Fail_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_WyrmwayAnnouncer
AD_Fail_0.text: The tale goes untold - a miscarriage of justice.

AD_Fail_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_WyrmwayAnnouncer
AD_Fail_1.text: You are unjust. An eye for an eye, lex talionis. The punishment must be proportional to the crime.

SolutionPainting1_1.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting1_1.text: *'The Hanging.' A red-haired man is depicted hanging from a gallows as a crowd looks on.*

SolutionPainting1_0.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting1_0.text: *You notice a child in the crowd, a falling tear leaving a trail on his cheek.*

SolutionPainting3_1.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting3_1.text: *'The Cell.' A stern prison guard slides a warm meal into the thief's cell.*

SolutionPainting3_0.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting3_0.text: *The red-haired man has a tenday left to serve, judging by the scratchings on the wall behind him.*

Painting5_0.speaker: Narrator
Painting5_0.text: *'The Chase'. A red-haired man is depicted running through the city streets, a Flaming Fist officer chasing just behind.*

Painting5_1.speaker: Narrator
Painting5_1.text: *A cloaked woman, hair dark as a raven, looks on from a safe distance.*

Painting6_1.speaker: Narrator
Painting6_1.text: *'The Judgement'. A stern judge, his pockets full of coin, orders a red-haired man to the gallows.*

Painting6_0.speaker: Narrator
Painting6_0.text: *A shiny apple rests on the ground nearby.*

SolutionPainting2_5.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting2_5.text: *'Freedom.' A red-haired man walks the streets of Baldur's Gate, clad in a billowing cloak.*

SolutionPainting2_3.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting2_3.text: *You catch a glimpse of a sly smile beneath his hood and a golden coin in his hand.*

SolutionPainting2_6.speaker: Wyll
SolutionPainting2_6.text: A thief walks free. Is this truly justice?

SolutionPainting3_AD_1.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting3_AD_1.text: *'The Cell.' A stern prison guard slides a warm meal into the thief's cell.*

SolutionPainting3_AD_0.speaker: Narrator
SolutionPainting3_AD_0.text: *The red-haired man has a tenday left to serve, judging by the scratchings on the wall behind him.*

AD_Success_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_WyrmwayAnnouncer
AD_Success_1.text: You banished the dishonourable judge and applied lex talionis, the principle of the sentence being proportional to the crime.

AD_Success_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_WyrmwayAnnouncer
AD_Success_0.text: You are a paragon of justice. Proceed.

Painting1_2.speaker: Narrator
Painting1_2.text: *'The Apple'. The painting depicts a red-haired man stealing a shiny apple from a cart in the open-air market called the Wide.*

Painting1_6.speaker: Narrator
Painting1_6.text: *'The Apple'. The painting depicts a red-haired man stealing a shiny apple from a cart in an open-air market.*

Painting1_9.speaker: Narrator
Painting1_9.text: *You know this market: The Wide, where Baldur's Gate's citizens and visitors gather to conduct trade and wax political.*

PAD_PaintingBlocked_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PaintingBlocked_0.text: The shadows are blocking me. I need to get rid of them - somehow.

Rules_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_WyrmwayAnnouncer
Rules_0.text: The dishonourable judge was banished, but judgement must still be passed.

Rules_11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_WyrmwayAnnouncer
Rules_11.text: Cleanse the world of those that would stand in the way of the righteous. But do not let such cleansing prevent justice.

Rules_18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_WyrmwayAnnouncer
Rules_18.text: A true champion knows justice and eliminates those who stand in its way.

Rules_16.speaker: Wyll
Rules_16.text: Justice. No pardon without repentance, and no penalty without mercy.

Rules_4.speaker: Wyll
Rules_4.text: The right path often lies between the extremes.

Rules_12.speaker: Astarion
Rules_12.text: Mercy? Please - justice should be a harsh lesson. All the better to deter the next vagabond.

Rules_14.speaker: Player
Rules_14.text: I'm with Astarion here. Off with every criminal's head, I say.

Rules_2.speaker: Wyll
Rules_2.text: If such violence is truly justice, then let it never again be called a virtue.

Rules_10.speaker: Player
Rules_10.text: Thank you for the wise words, Wyll. I'll keep them in mind.

Rules_8.speaker: Wyll
Rules_8.text: Wise indeed, though I can't take credit. It was my father who taught me the ways of the just.

Rules_3.speaker: Player
Rules_3.text: Is that a general aphorism of yours, or are you trying to be helpful?

Rules_6.speaker: Wyll
Rules_6.text: Both. Relevant words for times of strife - and for a dragon's underground trial, if we're lucky.

Rules_9.speaker: Player
Rules_9.text: I'd rather you keep your musings to yourself.

Rules_5.speaker: Wyll
Rules_5.text: Ask and receive. My lips are sealed.
